content.rendered:
With Lockdown 3.0 and Half-term in full swing, it may be a little bit difficult juggling family life, studying and keeping everything else going. Virtual events are a great way of escaping reality for a little while and focusing your mind elsewhere. We know it’s the not the same as physically doing an activity, but virtual events will have to do for now! Which is why for this month’s blog post, we’ve drawn up a little list of events that you can enjoy.
 

 

The Learning Zone February Event:

Following on from the success of last month’s Learning Zone Event, The School of Computing & AI are proud to host Dr Mike Howarth (Ex-BBC Producer) for the February Event.

The second event of the Learning Zone will see Dr Mike Howarth share ideas for students to use in project presentations and for the academic team to use in their business lectures.

It’s a story of top level communications BBC training. Dr Mike will share three ideas that benefit student learning online and help resolve the stress and worry of teaching online caused by Covid-19.

In addition, Dr Mike will demonstrate:

  1. How you can improve your physical home study set up
  2. Brush up your personal presentation style
  3. Ways to write simple scripts that release your creativity teaching ideas in sessions

The full details of the event have been left below:

When: Friday 26th February 2021 – From 5:00pm-6:00pm

Duration: 1 Hour

Link to attend: eventbrite.com

We are excited to host Dr Mike at the end of February and hope that both staff and students partake in the virtual event.
 

 

Virtual Museum Tour

If you’re a fan of Museum’s you’re guaranteed to love the Virtual Museum Tour. With the London Hidden London Tour, you will be able to explore stations and spaces in London with extremely restricted access that we’ll never be able to view in real life! You will also be able to uncover the fascinating stories of London’s transport history! This thrilling tour features photo’s, videos and never-before-seen footage from the collection! And if you want to know more, there will be a special Q+A Session once the tour finishes! Find out more here.

.

Homemade Chocolate Experience

This virtual event is perfect for all the Chocolate Fans! Instead of buying a pack on your next supermarket trip, you can take part in a live chocolate making masterclass. The 1-hour experience will teach you the secrets to great ganache, piping techniques, flavouring tips and how to decorate your masterpieces. Find out more here.

.

Stay Fit at Home

It’s not always easy staying fit at home, but there are a great range of Online Fitness Lessons that you can take part it. It’s not only important to stay physically fit, but also mentally too. Fitness and exercise plays a key part in helping keeping both healthy! Although you can find many online fitness classes, Karve is a new studio in London that is set to open soon, and until then, they are hosting online classes! Find out more here.
